name: 陳貞光
objective:
This course is aimed for, but not limited to, graduate students who are lack of background in Materials Science and Engineering. The topics will include: 1.The structure of crystalline solids, 2. imperfections in solids, 3. phase transformation and phase diagram,  4. properties, process and applications of metallic alloys, ceramics, and polymers.


本課程主要針對非材料系背景之研究生開設， 對各種材料（金屬、陶瓷、高分子、複合材料）之基本原理，性質及應用，做概要性的介紹。內容包括材料之晶體結構與晶體缺陷，固體材料之原子擴散，相圖與相變化，材料製程及應用，材料之物理性質（光性質、電性質、磁性質及熱性質）。
schedule:
Week 1- Ch.00 - Materials Science and Engineering - Overview
Week 2- Ch.01 - Introduction to Materials Science and Engineering
Week 3- Ch.02 - Atomic Structure and Bonding in Solids
Week 4/5- Ch.03 - Structures of Metals
Week 6- Ch.04 - Defects in Solids
Week 7/8- Ch.05 - Diffusion in Solids - I
Week 9- Midterm Exam
Week 10- Ch.06 - Mechanical Properties
Week 11- Ch.07 - Strengthening
Week 12- Ch.08 - Failure of Metals
Week 13- Ch.12 - Ceramics - Structure and Properties
Week 14- Ch.13 - Ceramics - Processing and Applications
Week 15- Ch.14 - Polymer - Structures
Week 16- Ch.15 - Polymer - Processing and Applications
Week 17- Ch.09 - Phase Diagrams/Ch.11 - Metals - Processing and Applications
Week 18- Final Exam
scorePolicy: 30% mid term exam，30% final exam，40% assignment and performance in class.
materials:
Materials Science and Engineering, by W.D.Callister Jr. and D.G.Rethwisch, 8th Ed. (SI version), 2011, John Wiley & Sons.
